page.title: 04HEDGEROWS AROUND WINCANTON
page.content: Throughout the year, hedgerows give pleasure and interest. In{Spring, flowers like Stitchwart,Bird's-Eye and Violets are common.{Summer}brings the pretty blooms of Dogrose and honey- suckle, whilst{Autumn}nuts and berries attract birds and small mammals.Bright ribbons of Bryony berries and the fluffy seed heads of Old Man's Beard (a lime loving plant and locally common) festoon the{Winter}hedgerow. Many hedgerow plants belong to the {carrot}family,like Hogweed.The{insects they attract are important to{farmers because they pollinate crops,eg clover and fruit trees, and prey on pests. { Hedge maintenance}is usually by flail mower but locally some are hand laid. If a hedge has a large variety of trees and shrubs in a short stretch,it is very old. Judging by this, some of our hedges have quite a history.
